name: Worship
oracle_text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

name: Deflection
oracle_text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
flavor_text:
"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can’t make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
If a spell targets multiple things, you can’t target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can’t target it with Deflection.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
The ability is put on the stack immediately after you cast a creature spell, which means the creature that spell will become won’t be a legal target.
The ability will still resolve even if the spell that triggered it gets countered.

rulings.text: Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

oracle_text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

rulings.text: This is not modal. You do not have to choose the target type. The target has to either be a land or non-black creature when announced and on resolution.

name: Bellowing Fiend
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

name: Bereavement
oracle_text: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
flavor_text: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.

rulings.text: If the player has no cards in hand, this has no effect.

name: Blood Pet
oracle_text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B}.
flavor_text: No thrull has ever been burdened with a long life.

rulings.text: Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

name: Bog Imp
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

name: Bog Wraith
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

name: Corrupt
oracle_text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player’s life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you’ll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

name: Crypt Rats
oracle_text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
flavor_text:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

name: Dakmor Lancer
oracle_text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor_text: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

name: Dark Banishing
oracle_text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"Hence ‘banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."
—William Shakespeare,
Romeo and Juliet

name: Darkest Hour
oracle_text: All creatures are black.
flavor_text: The eclipse made it clear whose side the sky was on.

rulings.text: Affected creatures lose all other colors and are mono-black.

name: Dregs of Sorrow
oracle_text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
flavor_text:
"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder

rulings.text: X can be zero.

name: Drudge Skeletons
oracle_text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral,
Necromancer's Handbook

name: Duress
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor_text: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

name: Eastern Paladin
oracle_text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
flavor_text:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Engineered Plague
oracle_text: As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
flavor_text: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

name: Fallen Angel
oracle_text: Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
—Fallen angel, to Serra

rulings.text: Can sacrifice itself.

name: Fear
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text: "Booga booga booga"

name: Foul Imp
oracle_text: Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
flavor_text: The villagers call it "winged stench."

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Fugue
oracle_text: Target player discards three cards.
flavor_text:
"It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"
—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin

name: Giant Cockroach
flavor_text: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

name: Gravedigger
oracle_text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

name: Greed
oracle_text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
flavor_text: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine ‘enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.

name: Hollow Dogs
oracle_text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

name: Howl from Beyond
oracle_text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

name: Infernal Contract
oracle_text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
flavor_text:
"East and West meet and angels cry.
Unholy power darkens the sky."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

rulings.text: If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

name: Leshrac's Rite
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text:
"Brackish water, dark and blind
Heed my will, to you I bind."
—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite

name: Looming Shade
oracle_text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

name: Megrim
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor_text: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

name: Mind Rot
oracle_text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor_text: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

name: Nausea
oracle_text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield when Nausea resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

name: Necrologia
oracle_text: Cast this spell only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Draw X cards.

rulings.text: This spell is cast during the End step. Since you discard down to 7 cards in the cleanup step, this card is used before the discard.

name: Nightmare
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor_text: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

name: Nocturnal Raid
oracle_text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.

rulings.text: On resolution, all black creatures on the battlefield get the bonus. Ones that enter the battlefield later in the turn do not get it.

name: Oppression
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
flavor_text:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

name: Ostracize
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor_text: "You won't be needing this."

name: Persecute
oracle_text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.
flavor_text: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now"

rulings.text: The color is chosen on resolution.

name: Plague Beetle
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: No one knows whether they were named for the diseases they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Rag Man
oracle_text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals their hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
flavor_text: He hunts what might have been.

name: Raise Dead
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

name: Razortooth Rats
oracle_text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text: They'll chew through armor, flesh, and bone. They'll even chew through each other if they're hungry enough.

name: Reprocess
oracle_text: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
flavor_text: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice zero permanents if you want to.

name: Revenant
oracle_text: Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor_text: It eats death and drinks pain.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Revenant’s power and toughness applies in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Revenant is in your graveyard, its ability will count itself.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor_text:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Serpent Warrior
oracle_text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor_text: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Soul Feast
oracle_text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
flavor_text: You are who you eat.

name: Spineless Thug
oracle_text: Spineless Thug can't block.
flavor_text: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

name: Strands of Night
oracle_text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor_text: When the strands call, only the dead answer.

name: Stronghold Assassin
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor_text: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

name: Tainted Aether
oracle_text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
flavor_text: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.

rulings.text: If the creature changes controllers before this ability resolves, its new controller has to sacrifice something.
If more than one of these is on the battlefield, the controller sacrifices a creature for each one of these.
If the controller has no other lands or creatures on the battlefield, they must sacrifice the creature that just entered the battlefield.
Tainted Aether’s controller is the one that controls its triggered ability, but the controller of the creature that entered the battlefield chooses what creature they sacrifice during resolution.

name: Unholy Strength
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
flavor_text: "I don't feel any different."

name: Wall of Bone
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text: A skeletal wall, strengthened by the souls of traitors, rings the city of the Eastern Paladin.

name: Western Paladin
oracle_text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
flavor_text:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—The Northern Paladin

name: Yawgmoth's Edict
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor_text: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.

name: Aether Flash
oracle_text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Aether Flash deals 2 damage to it.
flavor_text: As the foul beast appeared, arcane lightning crackled around it.

rulings.text: This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can’t be targeted by spells and abilities.

name: Balduvian Barbarians
flavor_text:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

name: Bedlam
oracle_text: Creatures can't block.
flavor_text: The generals were dead. The battle plans were forgotten. It was everyone for themselves.

name: Blaze
oracle_text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
flavor_text: Fire never dies alone.

name: Bloodshot Cyclops
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
flavor_text: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

name: Boil
oracle_text: Destroy all Islands.
flavor_text:
"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Crimson Hellkite
oracle_text: Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
flavor_text: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.

name: Disorder
oracle_text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
flavor_text:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin

rulings.text: Players take 0 or 2 damage. Disorder does not do 2 damage per creature to the player.

name: Earthquake
oracle_text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

name: Fervor
oracle_text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
flavor_text: The intensity of their glare was soon surpassed by the intensity of their attack.

rulings.text: If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won’t be removed from combat.

name: Final Fortune
oracle_text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
flavor_text: A reward is worthless if you aren't around to enjoy it.

rulings.text: If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
If multiple “extra turn” effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

name: Fire Elemental
flavor_text: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: It deals damage equal to its power to any target.
flavor_text: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.

name: Goblin Chariot
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

name: Goblin Digging Team
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
flavor_text:
"Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Die"
—Goblin chant

name: Goblin Elite Infantry
oracle_text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
We're elite. You're not.
—Infantry motto

name: Goblin Gardener
oracle_text: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
flavor_text: Years of attempts have brought the goblins no closer to growing a sausage tree.

rulings.text: The ability is not optional. You have to choose one of your own lands if your opponent has none.

name: Goblin Glider
oracle_text: Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
flavor_text:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle

name: Goblin King
oracle_text: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk.
flavor_text: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

name: Goblin Matron
oracle_text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, Goblin War Party is a card that references and creates Goblins, but it isn’t a Goblin card.

name: Goblin Raider
oracle_text: Goblin Raider can't block.
flavor_text: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.

name: Goblin Spelunkers
oracle_text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor_text: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.

name: Goblin War Drums
oracle_text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor_text: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.

rulings.text: When combined with an effect that reads “Each creature you control can’t be blocked by more than one creature,” none of your creatures can be blocked.
Multiple War Drums are not cumulative. They are redundant.

name: Granite Grip
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
flavor_text: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."

name: Hill Giant
flavor_text: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot.

name: Impatience
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor_text: "I'm going to count to three. Three."

rulings.text: If a spell is countered, it still counts as having been cast.

name: Inferno
oracle_text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor_text:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Wandering mage

name: Lava Axe
oracle_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor_text: "Catch"

name: Lightning Blast
oracle_text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor_text:
"I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"
—Former elvish scout

name: Lightning Elemental
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

name: Mana Clash
oracle_text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of their opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card’s coin flip has no winner or loser.

name: Ogre Taskmaster
oracle_text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
flavor_text: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

name: Okk
oracle_text: Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

name: Orcish Artillery
oracle_text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
flavor_text:
"Ready . . . aim . . . fire"
"Ow"

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn’t resolve because the target is illegal.

name: Orcish Oriflamme
oracle_text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

name: Pillage
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"Burn their homes. Salt their lands. Nothing survives."
—The Western Paladin

name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
oracle_text: Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

name: Pyroclasm
oracle_text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
flavor_text:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

name: Pyrotechnics
oracle_text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
flavor_text:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman

rulings.text: You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics’s targets become illegal, you can’t change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn’t dealt.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can’t be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

name: Raging Goblin
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

name: Reckless Embermage
oracle_text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to itself.
flavor_text: Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.

name: Reflexes
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

name: Relentless Assault
oracle_text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
flavor_text: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent’s turn, that opponent’s creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

name: Sabretooth Tiger
oracle_text: First strike
flavor_text: "Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh"

name: Seismic Assault
oracle_text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Earth arms itself with fire.

rulings.text: If an effect instructs you to draw cards and then discard cards, you can’t take actions in between. For example, if you have no cards in hand and cast Faithless Looting, you can’t activate Seismic Assault’s ability between the time you draw two cards and discard those two cards.

name: Shatter
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

name: Shivan Dragon
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

name: Shock
oracle_text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

name: Spitting Earth
oracle_text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
flavor_text:
"We were ready for an attack from the front, sides, or back—but the mage hit us from below."
—Veteran soldier

name: Stone Rain
oracle_text: Destroy target land.

name: Storm Shaman
oracle_text: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

name: Sudden Impact
oracle_text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
flavor_text: Caught red-handed.

name: Trained Orgg
flavor_text:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."
—Orgg trainer

name: Tremor
oracle_text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor_text: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?

name: Volcanic Hammer
oracle_text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

name: Wall of Fire
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The erupting flames work as both barrier and weapon.

name: Wildfire
oracle_text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
flavor_text: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.

name: Anaconda
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.

name: Ancient Silverback
oracle_text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

name: Birds of Paradise
oracle_text: Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

name: Blanchwood Armor
oracle_text: Enchant creature
